name: ResourceFragment
title: Resource Fragment
description: Defines fragments, possibly with ellipsed content, to generate from a specified resource for a embedding as part of resource pages.

element.definition: Defines fragments, possibly with ellipsed content, to generate from a specified resource for a embedding as part of resource pages.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: An Extension

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: An id that will be appended to the base resource name to form the name for this particular fragment

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: An Extension

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.definition: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html) for a list).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: The path to the element to use as the 'root' of the published fragment.  If not specified, the fragment root will be the resource root
element.comment: If specified, the FHIRPath SHALL resolve to a single element

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: An Extension

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.definition: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html) for a list).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: A path with a context of the fragment base that resolves to 1 or more elements that are to be ellipsed out of the generated fragment.
element.comment: If specified, the FHIRPath SHALL resolve to at least one element

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: An Extension

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.definition: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html) for a list).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Indicates one or more element paths where all child elements are to be ellipsed except for a specified subset

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: An Extension

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: FHIRPath to element(s) whose children will be ellipsed
element.definition: A FHIRPath with a context of the root of the fragment that resolves to the element(s) for which most children should be ellipsed.  If not specified, the base will be the root of the fragement
element.comment: If specified, must resolve to at least one element

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: An Extension

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.definition: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html) for a list).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: FHIRPath to element(s) to exclude from ellipsing
element.definition: FHIRPath to child element(s) that should NOT be ellipsed.  These will be excluded when ellipsing the child nodes.
element.comment: Must resolve to at least one element for at least one of the ellipse base elements.  If this resolves to elements that are not direct children of the element to be ellipsed, there will be no effect on those elements

element.definition: Defines fragments, possibly with ellipsed content, to generate from a specified resource for a embedding as part of resource pages.
An id that will be appended to the base resource name to form the name for this particular fragment
The path to the element to use as the 'root' of the published fragment.  If not specified, the fragment root will be the resource root
element.comment: If specified, the FHIRPath SHALL resolve to a single element

element.definition: A path with a context of the fragment base that resolves to 1 or more elements that are to be ellipsed out of the generated fragment.
element.comment: If specified, the FHIRPath SHALL resolve to at least one element

element.definition: Indicates one or more element paths where all child elements are to be ellipsed except for a specified subset

element.short: FHIRPath to element(s) whose children will be ellipsed
element.definition: A FHIRPath with a context of the root of the fragment that resolves to the element(s) for which most children should be ellipsed.  If not specified, the base will be the root of the fragement
element.comment: If specified, must resolve to at least one element

element.short: FHIRPath to element(s) to exclude from ellipsing
element.definition: FHIRPath to child element(s) that should NOT be ellipsed.  These will be excluded when ellipsing the child nodes.
element.comment: Must resolve to at least one element for at least one of the ellipse base elements.  If this resolves to elements that are not direct children of the element to be ellipsed, there will be no effect on those elements
